item.content:encoded: The US is no longer a nation of small business. 53% of Americans work for big businesses now (with 500+ workers). That's a big shift from the 1980s/90s/early 2000s. The biggest change of all has been more people working for companies with 10,000+ workers and fewer people

item.content:encoded: "For example, if we compare 2002 to 2022 ‚Äì an even twenty years, and a timeframe with more reliable starting data than 1998 ‚Äì Internet traffic increased by a factor of 1,000 while the price of transit decreased by a factor of 1,000. We could call that Jevons‚Ä¶ Flatline?"
